image.altText: Mawuyal Yanthalawuy Manganinnie publicity still

props.synopsis: Award-winning actor, educator and community leader Mawuyul Yanthalawuy, who starred in the film Manganinnie, is being remembered as a "national treasure" after her death at the age of 85.

title.children: Actor and educator Mawuyul Yanthalawuy AM remembered as 'national treasure'

image.altText: Thai woman with blue hat holds mango yet to be picked from tree

props.synopsis: Saramat "Tou" Ruchkaew had a successful marketing career in Thailand before she moved to Australia and became one of the NT's biggest mango growers.

title.children: From heels to work boots, mango farming is a dream come true for Thai businesswoman

image.altText: Children at a desk colouring in.

props.synopsis: The NT opposition has criticised a government plan to direct unpaid truancy fines to be taken out of the Centrelink payments as a campaign of "fear and punishment" against parents and says the government doesn't have the jurisdiction to do it.

title.children: NT minister's plan to take truancy fines from Centrelink payments branded a 'scare tactic'

image.altText: a graphic showing a male middle-aged police officer, a young man in a white collared shirt and a woman wearing a dress

props.synopsis: Every day of the coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, a sign reading "tell the truth" has stood outside the Alice Springs Local Court. Now, with final submissions heard, the NT coroner faces the task of finding that truth.

title.children: Coroner urged to find 'the truth' in Kumanjayi Walker case as inquest wraps up after two years

image.altText: Selina Middleton EDITED

props.synopsis: Methylamphetamine is taking a toll on the central Kimberley town of Fitzroy Crossing. It is a story playing out across Australia's top end.

title.children: Cheaper than grog and marijuana, meth is wreaking havoc on this small town

image.altText: Gavin Smith stands at the office in the caravan park wearing a green shirt and hat smiling.

props.synopsis: It's not your typical retirement plan but Gavin Smith is in it "boots and all" giving new life to a caravan park in a town he first fell in love with 50 years ago.

title.children: For Gavin's 70th birthday, he bought himself a caravan park in the outback

image.altText: A tall woman smiles through a crowd of footballers.

props.synopsis: Exmouth-born Mim Strom's record-breaking AFLW season has earned her plenty of plaudits, but women footballers in her home town are struggling to play competitive footy.

title.children: There may be no formal games in this outback town, but it hasn't stopped these women's footy players

image.altText: A damaged, dark-coloured taxi in an impound.

props.synopsis: Police say the suspects are still at large amid calls for more to be done to address crime in the city.

title.children: Alice Springs taxis allegedly rammed, driver robbed twice in stolen ute rampage

image.altText: The Roblox app displayed on a smartphone screen with a Roblox logo in the background.

props.synopsis: Roblox is one of the most popular platforms in the world, but there are increasing concerns over the ability for users to message each other directly through games, with young children being lured off-platform and exposed to disturbing content.

title.children: Sickening messages sent to children in Roblox chat rooms raise safety alarm for Australian parents

props.synopsis: As more cracks appear in the burgeoning super industry, performance won't take centre stage. The trust gap will.

title.children: New battleground starting to open up over superannuation

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: Halls Hut is one of Australia's most isolated sites. Its upkeep is becoming a political problem

image.altText: Albanese sits at the centre table in parliament, frowning as he looks up from paperwork

props.synopsis: In an ominous sign for the government, new research shows dissatisfaction with the direction of the country is at the same level as it was just before the Morrison government lost the election.

title.children: A freight train of voter anger might be about to hit Albanese

image.altText: An Indian/South Asian man with black facial hair speaks onstage wearing a light suit jacket with American flags behind him

props.synopsis: The incoming president has picked a long-term ally who has previously pledged to "shut down" the US federal intelligence agency.

title.children: Trump singles out loyalist Kash Patel to lead FBI

image.altText: A photo of residential apartments. One of them has been completely flattened by air strikes.

props.synopsis: Iran has reportedly promised to pay for the reconstruction, but unlike in 2006, Arab states have not committed funding.

title.children: Lebanese return to scenes of destruction in Beirut's suburbs as damage bill exceeds $5 billion

image.altText: three young sisters smile and look at the camera

props.synopsis: A review of NSW's out-of-home care arrangements paints a picture of a system plagued by inconsistent decision-making, lack of accountability and consultation which "punishes parents, carers and children".

title.children: 'Not fit for purpose' out-of-home care system failing vulnerable children in NSW, review finds

image.altText: A couple smiles.

props.synopsis: A couple found dead at their takeaway shop in Sydney's west have been identified as Hoa Tek Chiem and Kim Heang Gau.

title.children: 'I pray you both rest': Couple allegedly murdered at Western Sydney takeaway shop identified

image.altText: The sun beams through buildings on Adelaide's Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: With parts of the country already sweltering though heatwaves, support services are worried many people will not be able to afford to keep cool this year.

title.children: Concerns cost-of-living crisis could put more Australians at risk during potential heatwaves this summer

image.altText: A screenshot of the face of a man in a video.

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a video of an Israeli-American hostage in which he pleads for US President-elect Donald Trump to secure his release.

title.children: UN halts aid to Gaza after violence as hostage video released by Hamas

image.altText: Aline Gomes Amaro and Sham Freier collide as they compete for a header

props.synopsis: The Matildas have fallen short of a comeback against Brazil in their second international friendly on the Gold Coast, going down 2-1 in a physical encounter.

title.children: Spirited Matildas fall short of physical Brazil in 2-1 friendly defeat

image.altText: A figure points a camera directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: When ABC News reporter James Tugwell first pitched a story about the little-known but rapidly growing adventure sport of ice climbing in Australia, he didn't quite know what he was getting himself into.

title.children: Hooked on climbing ice from the first thud of the axe

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is primed for a 0.2 per cent rise this morning after another record close on Wall Street, but the markets will be watching this morning's releases of key retail and building data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX primed for new record after Wall Street rally rolls on, ahead of key retail sales and construction data this morning

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX set to inch higher to a new record

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with black hair and ear peircing

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he rejected Israeli right-wing politician Ayelet Shaked's application to come to Australia over concerns she would threaten social cohesion.

title.children: Home affairs minister details 'hard line' that led to a former Israeli minister's visa being denied

image.altText: Three different petrol station signs with prices on the board

props.synopsis: When it's time to fill up with petrol, paying extra at the pump can be financially costly. We've done the legwork for you and dispelled the myths about what controls prices and how they're determined.

title.children: Cheap Tuesdays are a 'thing of the past' but shopping around can help motorists save at the petrol pump

image.altText: A soldier waves from an army-khaki vehicle on a road surrounded by damaged houses and short shrubs

props.synopsis: A shock four-day offensive in Syria's north-east has seen territory held by the Assad regime since 2016 retaken by militant groups aiming to overthrow the government.

title.children: 'Game-changing' advances in Syria's civil war as government withdraws

image.altText: 19-year-old girl witih hair in braids and white top looks out to distance

props.synopsis: The major parties are united on the need to protect young people by banning them from social media. But experts say dialling back something that has become so pervasive in the lives of children and teenagers requires nuance — and more time — to get right.

title.children: Social media can harm kids' mental health. The question now is whether a ban will help or make it worse

image.altText: A Nelson Alexander office

props.synopsis: Nelson Alexander says information related to 89 historical tenancies was allegedly stolen from its office in the city's inner-north last month.

title.children: Names, numbers, identity documents feared stolen from Melbourne real estate agency

image.altText: Lewis Hamilton driving his F1 Mercedes with sparks flying from a tyre puncture

props.synopsis: A rouge mirror and the failure of race officials to clear it off the track has been deemed "dangerous" for a former world champion, and blown Formula 1's constructors' championship wide open.

title.children: 'Dangerous' inaction causes chaos in Qatar as Norris penalty blows constructors' championship open

image.altText: a blue eureka flag with a white cross and southern cross flies above a red brick building at dusk

props.synopsis: As the 170th anniversary of the Eureka Rebellion rolls around, experts say the true story of the event — and its iconic Southern Cross flag — need to be remembered.

title.children: The Eureka Stockade and its flag are often misunderstood and misappropriated. The real story is one of unity

image.altText: A young white boy with red hair sitting in a wheelchair smiling at an adult. They're in a school classroom

props.synopsis: Families and schools say it's more than possible to set children with disability up for success with their education. These are some of their best tips.

title.children: Whether you're a parent or educator, there are ways to set children with disability up for success at school

image.altText: A man wearing a flower ring on the neck.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te stops over at Hawaii and Guam as part of a week-long trip in the South Pacific, as Beijing warns the United States to handle the Taiwan issue with "utmost caution".

title.children: Taiwan president kicks off Pacific tour with US stops, drawing anger from Beijing

image.altText: Kangaroos players celebrate with a group hug after a goal

props.synopsis: North Melbourne became the first team, male or female, to win an AFL premiership while going through a season undefeated. Gemma Bastiani unpicks how the Kangaroos did it.

title.children: North Melbourne's perfect AFLW season didn't happen overnight

image.altText: A fisherman holding a big fish on a boat.

props.synopsis: Catching a barramundi measuring more than 1 metre is considered the holy grail of fishing, but anglers targeting trophy fish in one of Australia's biggest river catchments are blowing this out of the water.

title.children: Big barra hunters reeling after record-breaking Queensland season

image.altText: Ian Redpath sits in his whites with his feet up in the changerooms while having a drink in 1976

props.synopsis: Ian Redpath, the unflappable opener of 66 Tests and member of the Australian cricket hall of fame, dies aged 83.

title.children: Ian Redpath, stoic Australian Test opener and hall of fame member, dies aged 83

image.altText: A crowd of sport spectators in green and gold cheer for joy, behind an out-of-focus soccer player in a blue jersey

props.synopsis: A government report has secretly examined if the state can run Queensland's crown jewel of stadiums, Lang Park, as well as a private company with intimate political connections.

title.children: Inside Lang Park's secret event: Who should run Suncorp Stadium?

image.altText: A woman with voluminous hair taking an image of herself in a bathroom mirror.

props.synopsis: Set against the backdrop of social change in the 1970s, Carol Jerrems's photography charted the women's movement, documented First Nations activism, put a spotlight on youth subcultures, and explored the era's music and arts scenes.

title.children: Era-defining photos of cultural icons and 'languid hangouts in share-house backyards' go on display
